title: Aggravate monster
data:
- *This article is about the property. For the monster spell and effect, see [aggravation](/wiki/Aggravation "Aggravation").*

**Aggravate monster** is a [property](/wiki/Property "Property") in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that makes it easier for monsters to notice and track the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 NetHack brass](#NetHack_brass)
  - [3.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [3.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.4 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [3.5 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [3.6 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [3.7 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [4 References](#References)

## Description

While you have the aggravate monster property, any [sleeping](/wiki/Sleeping "Sleeping") [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") nearby have a higher chance of waking up if you move while in their line of sight.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Monsters are also able to track you even if they cannot see you. Additionally, pets have their [tameness](/wiki/Tameness "Tameness") halved when you abuse them while you have the property, instead of being reduced by one.

There are multiple sources of the aggravate monster property, and almost all of them are intrinsic: the sole [extrinsic](/wiki/Extrinsic "Extrinsic") source is to [put on](/wiki/Put_on "Put on") or [wear](/wiki/Wear "Wear") a [ring of aggravate monster](/wiki/Ring_of_aggravate_monster "Ring of aggravate monster"). The intrinsic is typically permanent, and is obtained from the following actions:

- [Eating](/wiki/Eat "Eat") the [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") of any [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") [feline](/wiki/Feline "Feline") or [canine](/wiki/Canine "Canine"). [Orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") heroes and [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople") are exempt from this.
- Eating the corpse or tin of a monster of your race. Orcs and Cavepeople are also exempt.
- [Eating](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") a ring of aggravate monster.
- [Sacrificing](/wiki/Sacrificing "Sacrificing") a former [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") that died while it was still [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") - a pet that went feral before dying is fine to sacrifice.

[Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur") allows monsters to track you while wielded, and the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") causes monsters that are often generated sleeping to be created awake - this is *not* the same as the aggravate monster property.

## Strategy

As an intrinsic, the aggravate monster property is very difficult to get rid of, with the only methods of doing so being unreliable: the intrinsic can only be removed if a [gremlin](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin") steals it from you at [night](/wiki/Night "Night"), or you eat a [disenchanter](/wiki/Disenchanter "Disenchanter") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") - you are likely to lose a number of good intrinsics before losing the intended one. In most cases, it is better to just finish the game with the intrinsic, especially if you also have [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth") (which almost completely nullifies the property's effects).

## Variants

### NetHack brass

In [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass"), male heroes that wear the following armor will gain the aggravate monster property:

- [nurse cap](/wiki/Nurse_cap "Nurse cap")
- [nurse uniform](/wiki/Nurse_uniform "Nurse uniform")
- [maid dress](/wiki/Maid_dress "Maid dress")
- [frilled apron](/wiki/Frilled_apron "Frilled apron")
- [katyusha](/wiki/Katyusha "Katyusha")

The armor in question is primarily based on fanservice tropes.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), "aggravation" is an [object property](/wiki/Object_property "Object property") that can occur on any item, and causes the item to confer aggravate monster while worn or wielded.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [The Arkenstone](/wiki/The_Arkenstone "The Arkenstone") and [The Mantle of Wrath](/wiki/The_Mantle_of_Wrath "The Mantle of Wrath") confer aggravate monster while carried; The Mantle of Wrath blocks all sources of aggravate monster while worn.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), aggravate monster is one of the intrinsic properties a non-cursed [potion of wonder](/wiki/Potion_of_wonder "Potion of wonder") can confer when [quaffed](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff"); dipping an appropriate item in a non-cursed potion also has a chance of randomly bestowing aggravate monster as an object property.

### SpliceHack

In older versions of [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [angel](/wiki/Angel_\(starting_race\) "Angel (starting race)") heroes start with the aggravate monster intrinsic.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [giant](/wiki/Giant_\(starting_race\) "Giant (starting race)") heroes start with the aggravate monster intrinsic, and most sources of stealth will not grant the property to counteract it, though they can gain the intrinsic as normal through some other means (e.g. as a boon from successful [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") on a co-aligned altar).

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), [ogre](/wiki/Ogre_\(starting_race\) "Ogre (starting race)") heroes start with the aggravate monster intrinsic.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/monmove.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 232](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monmove.c#L232)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Aggravate monster

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
This article is about the property. For the monster spell and effect, see aggravation.

Aggravate monster is a property in NetHack that makes it easier for monsters to notice and track the hero.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 NetHack brass
    • 3.2 GruntHack
    • 3.3 dNetHack
    • 3.4 FIQHack
    • 3.5 SpliceHack
    • 3.6 EvilHack
    • 3.7 SlashTHEM
  • 4 References

Description

While you have the aggravate monster property, any sleeping monsters nearby have a higher chance of waking up if you move while in their line of sight.[1] Monsters are also able to track you even if they cannot see you. Additionally, pets have their tameness halved when you abuse them while you have the property, instead of being reduced by one.

There are multiple sources of the aggravate monster property, and almost all of them are intrinsic: the sole extrinsic source is to put on or wear a ring of aggravate monster. The intrinsic is typically permanent, and is obtained from the following actions:

  • Eating the corpse or tin of any domestic feline or canine. Orcish heroes and Cavepeople are exempt from this.
  • Eating the corpse or tin of a monster of your race. Orcs and Cavepeople are also exempt.
  • Eating a ring of aggravate monster.
  • Sacrificing a former pet that died while it was still tame - a pet that went feral before dying is fine to sacrifice.

Excalibur allows monsters to track you while wielded, and the Amulet of Yendor causes monsters that are often generated sleeping to be created awake - this is not the same as the aggravate monster property.

Strategy

As an intrinsic, the aggravate monster property is very difficult to get rid of, with the only methods of doing so being unreliable: the intrinsic can only be removed if a gremlin steals it from you at night, or you eat a disenchanter corpse or tin - you are likely to lose a number of good intrinsics before losing the intended one. In most cases, it is better to just finish the game with the intrinsic, especially if you also have stealth (which almost completely nullifies the property's effects).

Variants

NetHack brass

In NetHack brass, male heroes that wear the following armor will gain the aggravate monster property:

  • nurse cap
  • nurse uniform
  • maid dress
  • frilled apron
  • katyusha

The armor in question is primarily based on fanservice tropes.

GruntHack

In GruntHack, "aggravation" is an object property that can occur on any item, and causes the item to confer aggravate monster while worn or wielded.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, The Arkenstone and The Mantle of Wrath confer aggravate monster while carried; The Mantle of Wrath blocks all sources of aggravate monster while worn.

FIQHack

In FIQHack, aggravate monster is one of the intrinsic properties a non-cursed potion of wonder can confer when quaffed; dipping an appropriate item in a non-cursed potion also has a chance of randomly bestowing aggravate monster as an object property.

SpliceHack

In older versions of SpliceHack, angel heroes start with the aggravate monster intrinsic.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, giant heroes start with the aggravate monster intrinsic, and most sources of stealth will not grant the property to counteract it, though they can gain the intrinsic as normal through some other means (e.g. as a boon from successful prayer on a co-aligned altar).

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, ogre heroes start with the aggravate monster intrinsic.

References

  1. ↑ src/monmove.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 232

{{otheruses|the property|the monster spell and effect|aggravation}}
'''Aggravate monster''' is a [[property]] in ''[[NetHack]]'' that makes it easier for monsters to notice and track the [[hero]].

==Description==
While you have the aggravate monster property, any [[sleeping]] [[monster]]s nearby have a higher chance of waking up if you move while in their line of sight.{{refsrc|src/monmove.c|232|nethack=3.6.7}} Monsters are also able to track you even if they cannot see you. Additionally, pets have their [[tameness]] halved when you abuse them while you have the property, instead of being reduced by one.

There are multiple sources of the aggravate monster property, and almost all of them are intrinsic: the sole [[extrinsic]] source is to [[put on]] or [[wear]] a [[ring of aggravate monster]]. The intrinsic is typically permanent, and is obtained from the following actions:

* [[Eat]]ing the [[corpse]] or [[tin]] of any [[domestic]] [[feline]] or [[canine]]. [[Orc (starting race)|Orcish]] heroes and [[Cavepeople]] are exempt from this.
* Eating the corpse or tin of a monster of your race. Orcs and Cavepeople are also exempt.
* [[Eating jewelry|Eating]] a ring of aggravate monster.
* [[Sacrificing]] a former [[pet]] that died while it was still [[tame]] - a pet that went feral before dying is fine to sacrifice.

[[Excalibur]] allows monsters to track you while wielded, and the [[Amulet of Yendor]] causes monsters that are often generated sleeping to be created awake - this is ''not'' the same as the aggravate monster property.

==Strategy==
As an intrinsic, the aggravate monster property is very difficult to get rid of, with the only methods of doing so being unreliable: the intrinsic can only be removed if a [[gremlin]] steals it from you at [[night]], or you eat a [[disenchanter]] [[corpse]] or [[tin]] - you are likely to lose a number of good intrinsics before losing the intended one. In most cases, it is better to just finish the game with the intrinsic, especially if you also have [[stealth]] (which almost completely nullifies the property's effects).

==Variants==
===NetHack brass===
In [[NetHack brass]], male heroes that wear the following armor will gain the aggravate monster property:

* [[nurse cap]]
* [[nurse uniform]]
* [[maid dress]]
* [[frilled apron]]
* [[katyusha]]

The armor in question is primarily based on fanservice tropes.

===GruntHack===
In [[GruntHack]], "aggravation" is an [[object property]] that can occur on any item, and causes the item to confer aggravate monster while worn or wielded.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[The Arkenstone]] and [[The Mantle of Wrath]] confer aggravate monster while carried; The Mantle of Wrath blocks all sources of aggravate monster while worn.

===FIQHack===
In [[FIQHack]], aggravate monster is one of the intrinsic properties a non-cursed [[potion of wonder]] can confer when [[quaff]]ed; dipping an appropriate item in a non-cursed potion also has a chance of randomly bestowing aggravate monster as an object property.

===SpliceHack===
In older versions of [[SpliceHack]], [[Angel (starting race)|angel]] heroes start with the aggravate monster intrinsic.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], [[Giant (starting race)|giant]] heroes start with the aggravate monster intrinsic, and most sources of stealth will not grant the property to counteract it, though they can gain the intrinsic as normal through some other means (e.g. as a boon from successful [[prayer]] on a co-aligned altar).

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], [[Ogre (starting race)|ogre]] heroes start with the aggravate monster intrinsic.
